subject: postdoc position in data simulation,  machine learning and robotics @ ecole centrale de lyon,  france (prof. liming chen)
content: a 1-year post-doctoral position extensible to 3 years is opened on data simulation, machine learning and robotics within the imagine team, liris lab at ecole centrale de lyon .  the complete description is available at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__docs.google.com_document_d_1xbrx8h7favwp1jy9eplexatthzkdq3vx0hsqvg4xuga_edit-3fusp-3dsharing&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bd6xtbb37mrumzyiw2cg4vdpm_agmxvrf0i3tsx6s1y&s=kr-bxuvaqtlvzsnloipozr_oojzxqwnzaiawtn4o7jg&e=  research objective  the pikaflex and ar?s projects are aimed to develop intelligent grasping robots endowed with vision and learning capabilities for the specific task of picking and kitting. state of the art approach is currently deep learning-based and requires a huge number of labeled data which is very expensive to obtain. in this research project, we aim to simulate scene data along with grasping robots and make them realistic through generative adversarial network (gan). interested candidates are invited to read our recent publication at iros 2018 on the jacquard dataset for further details. profile  we are seeking a highly motivated postdoctoral fellow in the field of data simulation, infographics, machine learning and robotics. curiosity, open-mind, creativity, persistence, and collaborative-work ability are the key personal skills we target. a ph.d. in master of engineering, applied mathematics or computer science is required, with demonstrated experience and a high quality publication record on one or several of the following topics:      * data simulation      * computer graphics and physics engine      * machine learning and computer vision  the successful candidate should have advanced programming skills (python, c/c++, matlab) with experience. a solid background in data simulation, computer graphics, and machine learning is required (with strong background in mathematics). knowledge on general simulation tools, e.g., unity 3d, blender, pybullet, is definitively an advantage, as well as experience with simulation for robotics (e.g. gazebo, v-rep) and the physics properties of the simulation (e.g. deformable objects). while fluency in french is not required, fluency in english is mandatory. both beginning and more senior postdoctoral candidates are encouraged to apply. environment  the successful candidate will work in direct collaboration with researchers having an established expertise in computer vision and machine learning in partnership with a major industrial company in robotics and a world leading car maker. ecole centrale de lyon is part of the top ten engineering schools in france (grande ecoles), part of the elite of "grande ?coles" offering access to excellent quality graduate and undergraduate students.  the liris lab is a large cnrs supported laboratory federating research groups in computer science from 4 universities in lyon, namely universit? claude bernard, universit? lumi?res, insa de lyon and ecole centrale de lyon. it offers a unique environment where innovative, multidisciplinary, foundational and applied research is conducted on topics ranging from management of data, knowledge and services, to image processing and analysis, modeling, simulation and rendering.  the postdoc position offers full health, unemployment and retirement benefits and competitive salary. the candidate will be given the opportunity to develop his/her research skills and experience, to contribute if desired to the acquisition of new funding and to the development of cutting edge computer vision and machine learning techniques with application to robotics, with possible teaching opportunities as well as student mentoring. application  applications should include a curriculum vitae, brief statements of research interests, a link to the ph.d. thesis, and the names of at least three references. candidates are requested to ask references to send their letters directly by email.  applications and letters should be sent via electronic mail to:      * pr. liming chen ( liming.chen at ec-lyon.fr )      * dr. emmanuel dellandr?a ( emmanuel.dellandrea at ec-lyon.fr )  the deadline for the application submission is set to december 1st, 2018 for a preferred start date on january 7, 2019.  	 dr. maxime petit  postdoctoral researcher  robotics & machine learning  	 a: 	 ecole centrale de lyon  36 av. guy de collongue  69134 ?cully, france  w: 	 www.researchgate.net  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__scholar.google.fr&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bd6xtbb37mrumzyiw2cg4vdpm_agmxvrf0i3tsx6s1y&s=uvprltseac95eyc-kc44f0ehhhzplb5um9wzoovpgaa&e=  pint of science & tedx talks

subject: phd fellowship in computer science -  virtual embodied assistant for remote and isolated caregivers
content: *phd fellowship* french version below subject: modelling a humanoid virtual assistant for remote and isolated caregivers. supervisor: ronan querrec co-supervisors: elisabetta bevacqua enib - brest national school of engineering lab-sticc - laboratory in the field of information, communication and knowledge science keywords: embodied conversational agents, multimodal data analysis and generation, medical procedures and assistance data, system trustworthiness. the phd project is part of the anr vr-mars project that aims at implementing an assistance system designed for emergency care support in remote and isolated sites. the system will be based on virtual reality (rv) and embodied conversational agents (ecas). we hypothesize that these two technologies improve the situation understanding and the coordination of all the stakeholders: a remote caregiver and the referent expert centre. the vr-mars case study will focus on space medicine and the simulation of emergency care during a manned mission on mars. the geographic distance will be doubled by the temporal isolation, due to the communication latency between the caregiver (on mars) and the expert centre (on earth). the goal of this phd is to design, implement and evaluate the virtual assistant.  the virtual assistant must be able to support the caregiver to go through a medical procedure and to help them to keep the stress level under control. it must also transmit orders from the expert centre to the remote medical team imposing its authority if necessary. the phd is organized around 4 main tasks: 1. state of the art: firstly, a thorough study of the state of the art will be fundamental to define, on the one hand, how humans help others to manage their level of stress and, on the other hand, how they give orders. 2. multimodal data pre-processing: some experimentation are being currently conducted in order to tests eca's features. we want to evaluate medical emergency situations (such as severe acute appendicitis or leg fracture) involving functionalities considered as dedicated to the eca, but carried either by caregivers or by elementary cognitive supports. the aim is to collect data that will help us to conceptualize the functionalities of the eca and that will provide us with examples of the multimodal behaviours that the agent should be able to show. 3. computational modelling and implementation in an embodied conversational agent: this step will require to integrate the knowledge acquired during the first two steps to propose and implement a model of the virtual assistant. 4. evaluation: the model will be evaluated through experiments conducted in collaboration with the other partners of the project. the phd is fully funded during 3 years as part of the anr vr-mars project. the work will be realized at the european centre for virtual reality (cerv), a very well-known laboratory, specialized in autonomous behaviour modelling and human/system interaction. more precisely, the thesis will be developed within the lab-sticc. *the candidate* the phd candidate should have a master's degree completed in computer science, applied mathematics. knowledge of multimodal data processing and multimodal behaviour generation are considered as a major asset. french language is not required but very appreciated. *application* the application files should contain the following documents: - a detailed curriculum, - a description of the academic background and a copy of academic records and most recent diploma, - a cover letter describing why the applicant wishes to participate in this project and his/her research's adequacy with the proposed topics - 2 recommendation letters (including one from the master or equivalent diploma supervisor) the application files (or any question) should be sent to: elisabetta bevacqua: bevacqua at enib.fr and ronan querrec: querrec at enib.fr ** further information ** *the european centre for virtual reality* the cerv technology platform is part of the engineering national school of brest which is attached to the umr-cnrs (french national research centre) lab-sticc. it consists of about 30 researchers with backgrounds in computer science, mathematics, cognitive science and psychology. main topics are virtual reality, artificial autonomous behaviour, natural interaction, cognitive sciences and embodied conversational agents. cerv will provide a rich and dynamic intellectual environment for a young phd student. *brest* brest is a mid-sized town of 150,000 residents nestled in the natural brest roadstead, at the west end of brittany. important harbour and second french military port, brest possesses also several educational institutes, like "grandes ecoles" and top-level universities, museums and "le quartz", a very well known national theatre. in addition to its scientific, scholarly and cultural strengths, brest boasts outstanding recreational activities. its residents may have an easy access to climbing, sailing, fishing, biking and swimming. even a simple walk along the seaside becomes a unique experience thanks to the breathtaking landscape. more information can be found here: www.brest.fr and www.brest-metropole-tourisme.fr ------------ version fran?aise *bourse de doctorat* sujet : un mod?le d'assistant virtuel humano?de pour une ?quipe m?dicale en milieu isol? et ?loign?. directeur : ronan querrec encadrante : elisabetta bevacqua enib - ?cole nationale d'ing?nieurs de brest lab-sticc - laboratoire des sciences et techniques de l'information, de la communication et de la connaissance mots clefs : agents conversationnels anim?e, analyse et g?n?ration de donn?es multimodales, proc?dures m?dicales et assistance m?dicale, fiabilit? et confiance dans le syst?me informatique. la bourse de doctorat fait partie du projet anr vr-mars qui vise ? cr?er un syst?me d'assistance con?u pour le soin d'urgence en milieu isol?, bas? sur la r?alit? virtuelle et les agents conversationnels anim?s (acas). notre hypoth?se est que ces deux technologies permettent d'am?liorer la conscience de la situation et la coordination du soin pour les intervenants : un soignant isol?, et un centre expert de r?f?rence. le cas d'?tude de vr-mars concernera la m?decine spatiale, avec une simulation de soin d'urgence lors d'une mission habit?e sur mars. l'?loignement g?ographique sera doubl? d'un isolement temporel, d? ? la latence dans les communications entre le soignant (sur mars) et le centre expert (sur terre). l'objectif de ce doctorat est de mod?liser, impl?menter et ?valuer un assistant virtuel. cet assistant doit ?tre capable de soutenir le soignant pendant la r?alisation d'une proc?dure m?dicale et de l'aider ? garder son niveau de stress sous contr?le. il doit aussi transmettre les ordres provenant du centre expert ? l'?quipe m?dicale ?loign?e en imposant son autorit? si n?cessaire. le travail du doctorant sera organis? autour de quatre t?ches principales : 1. ?tat de l'art : initialement, une ?tude approfondie de l'?tat de l'art sera fondamentale pour d?finir le comportement montr? par les humains lorsqu'ils visent ? garder le niveau de stress sous contr?le et lorsqu'ils doivent donner un ordre. 2. traitement des donn?es multimodales : des exp?rimentations sur simulateur sont actuellement men?es afin de pr?-tester les fonctionnalit?s de l'aca. il s'agit d'?valuer des situations d'urgence m?dicale (telles qu'une appendicite aigu? grave ou une fracture de jambe) impliquant des fonctionnalit?s envisag?es comme d?di?es ? l'aca, mais port?es soit par des soignants, soit par des aides cognitives ?l?mentaires. l'objectif est de disposer de premiers r?sultats permettant de conceptualiser les fonctionnalit?s de l'aca et d'en extraire les comportements multimodaux que l'aca devrait ?tre capable de montrer. 3. d?finition d'un mod?le et son impl?mentation pour un agent conversationnel anim? : pendant cette ?tape les connaissances recueillies lors des deux ?tapes pr?c?dentes seront utilis?es pour cr?er un mod?le d'assistant virtuel. 4. ?valuation : enfin, le mod?le sera ?valu? ? travers plusieurs ?tudes qui seront men?es en collaboration avec les autres partenaires du projet. le doctorat est enti?rement financ? pour trois ans par le projet anr vr-mars. le travail sera men? au centre europ?en de r?alit? virtuelle (cerv), un laboratoire reconnu et sp?cialis? dans la mod?lisation du comportement autonome et l'interaction humain/syst?me. plus pr?cis?ment, la th?se sera men?e au sein du lab-sticc. *candidat(e)* le/la candidat/e doit avoir un master 2 en informatique, math?matique appliqu?. des connaissances de traitement de donn?es multimodales et de g?n?ration de comportements multimodaux seront consid?r?es un atout majeur. la connaissance de la langue fran?aise n'est pas obligatoire mais tr?s appr?ci?e. *candidature* tout candidature doit contenir les documents suivants : - un curriculum vitae d?taill?, - une copie de r?sultats scolaires ? partir de deux derni?res ann?es de l'?cole sup?rieure, - une lettre de motivation expliquant pourquoi le(la) candidat(e) serait fait(e) pour le poste propos?. - au moins 2 lettres de recommandation, dont une de la part de l'encadrant de master 2 (ou ?quivalent). la candidature (ainsi que tout question) doit ?tre envoy?e ? : elisabetta bevacqua: bevacqua at enib.fr et ronan querrec: querrec at enib.fr ** informations ult?rieures ** *le centre europ?en de r?alit? virtuelle* le cerv est une plate-forme technologique appartenant ? l'enib qui est tutelle du lab-sticc (un umr-cnrs). environ 30 chercheurs avec diff?rents formations (telles que informatique, math?matique, science cognitive et psychologie) travaillent au cerv. les th?matiques principales sont la r?alit? virtuelle, le comportement artificiel autonome, l'interaction naturelle entre l'humain et le syst?me informatique, les agents conversationnels anim?s. le cerv constituera un environnement intellectuel riche et dynamique pour un jeune doctorant. *brest* brest est une ville de taille moyenne de 150 000 habitants nich?e dans la rade de brest, ? l'extr?mit? ouest de la bretagne. port important et deuxi?me port militaire fran?ais, brest poss?de ?galement plusieurs instituts tels que des grandes ?coles et des universit?s de haut niveau, les mus?es et "le quartz", un th??tre national tr?s connu. en plus de ses atouts scientifiques, universitaires et culturels, brest poss?de des activit?s r?cr?atives exceptionnelles. ses r?sidents peuvent avoir facilement acc?s ? l'escalade, la voile, la p?che, le v?lo et la natation. m?me une simple promenade au bord de la mer devient une exp?rience unique gr?ce ? la beaut? des paysages. pour plus d'informations voir : www.brest.fr et www.brest-metropole-tourisme.fr

subject: postdoctoral research position in image  processing and fusion at lirmm france in-reply-to: <9a5b12c3-9dc7-bdfe-c031-b0db81323b07@lirmm.fr> references: <9a5b12c3-9dc7-bdfe-c031-b0db81323b07@lirmm.fr>
content: dear all, we have a postdoctoral research position in the field of image  processing and fusion at lirmm lab. - university of montpellier - france. this position is within a new translational research project at lirmm  lab. in collaboration with the ent department of the montpellier hospital that concerns ??surgical gesture guidance for auditory  neuroprosthestics implantation based on us/ct images fusion??. this project is funded by the ??act for audition foundation??. context: cochlear implant is first functional implantable neuroprosthestic device  in human. it restores the auditory perception in people with severe to  profound deafness. the implantation of such a device requires the insertion into the  cochlea of an electrode array allowing electrical stimulation of  auditory nerve end fibbers. however, this insertion is a critical point of the surgery since the  surgeon cannot control visually the trajectory of the electrode array  and has to rely on its tactile feedback. this is responsible in many cases of damages of the cochlear structures  and of the loss of residual hearing, thus preventing the extension of  cochlear implant to people with milder hearing loss. in this project, we aim at developing a new tool to help cochlear  electrode arrays? insertion using the fusion of intraoperative  ultrasound (us) imaging and preoperative x-ray ct scan. a new custom made us probe dedicated to  cochlear navigation is under development. the candidate will be responsible for : - developing and validating a new algorithm for us/ct image fusion and  registration for cochlear imaging, - implementing the developed algorithm in a navigation software allowing  real-time rendering of fused us-ct imaging to be able to use it in a  clinical set-up, - validating it in ex-vivo experimental platforms and on cadavers. we are looking for candidates with strong analytical background and  hands-on experience in systems integration and medical image processing. she/he should have a phd degree in medical image processing or related  disciplines. previous experience in computer-assisted surgery is highly  appreciated. english: cefr b2 level (minimum) salary: montpellier university grid ? according to cv contract duration: 12 months (renewable) expected starting date: january 2019 laboratory / team: lirmm lab., robotics department, dexter team, medical  robotics group application: thanks for sending your cv, a cover letter, and contact information of  two referees to: philippe.poignet at lirmm.fr and nabil.zemiti at lirmm.fr regards nabil zemiti, phd 	 activit? inscriptions aux dipl?mes certifi?e iso 9001 v2015

subject: post-doc position] real-time solution  to detect and mitigate inattentional deafness to auditory alarms in  simulated and real flight conditions
content: post-doc position is available at isae-supaero, toulouse, france conception and control of aerospace vehicles department (dcas) neuroergonimics and human factor team https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.isae-2dsupaero.fr_fr_videos_isae-2dsupaero-2dneuro-2dergonomics-2dand-2dhuman-2dfactors-2dscientific-2dresearch_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nee1isfenz9hdsfssliy4w2ryz_fifaeatfjumlrq8e&s=qneh1s-ukzanumzdvql-kjvufdhhrffxoamcx3z9a5c&e= maia project: implementation of real-time solution to detect and  mitigate inattentional deafness to auditory alarm in simulated and real  flight conditions context: individuals often have reduced ability to hear alarms in real  world situations (e.g. flying an airplane) when their attention is  focused on another task, sometimes with devastating consequences. this  phenomenon, known as inattentional deafness, usually occurs under  critical high workload conditions such as in aviation related tasks.  experiments conducted at isae-supaero in simulated and real flight  conditions, using electro-encephalography (eeg), have allowed to  identify neural markers and precursors related to this phenomenon. objective: the challenge of this post-doctoral position will be to  implement a passive brain-computer interface (pbci) to 1) predict the  occurrence inattentional deafness and, 2) to develop a stochastic-based  decision system to dynamically adapt pilot-cockpit interaction to  mitigate this phenomenon. experiments will be conducted in motion flight  simulators and real airplane conditions. the post doc will directly  cooperate with another post doc fellow ? also hired for this project -  who has a background in neuroscience and electrophysiology. candidate?s profile - for eu and american citizens: ? artificial intelligence, automated planning (mdp, pomdp),  machine-learning (supervised/unsupervised classifiers) ? brain computer interface ? brain connectivity ? software architectures start & duration: the position starts in january 2019 for a duration of  36 months. contact: prof. f. dehais (frederic.dehais at isae.fr ), dr. c. chanel  (caroline.chanel at isae.fr) and r. roy (raphaelle.roy at isae.fr) regards, caroline p.c. chanel --  signature email isae-supaero 	 caroline p. carvalho chanel ing?nieur chercheur caroline.chanel at isae-supaero.fr +33 5 61 33 81 50 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__personnel.isae-2dsupaero.fr_caroline-2dchanel&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nee1isfenz9hdsfssliy4w2ryz_fifaeatfjumlrq8e&s=nojjf88q1d6klwr64cespu_am_iwph8ocy02vm54bws&e= 	 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.isae-2dsupaero.fr&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nee1isfenz9hdsfssliy4w2ryz_fifaeatfjumlrq8e&s=3mqyl4sdiukpdyme2fhyzze2chnbmfnmtni4jzzk200&e= institut sup?rieur de l'a?ronautique et de l'espace 10, avenue edouard belin - bp 54032 31055 toulouse cedex 4 france 	 isae supaero <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__fr-2dfr.facebook.com_isae.supaero&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nee1isfenz9hdsfssliy4w2ryz_fifaeatfjumlrq8e&s=sdvfjngnoytq2p4m9yrgn4fcq_k6unimc9nep_x4nyu&e=> @isae_officiel <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__twitter.com_isae-5fofficiel&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nee1isfenz9hdsfssliy4w2ryz_fifaeatfjumlrq8e&s=sroqn0uspjfdukes7hjxp5hzfv9vqqcxbgy0vdbgdee&e=> @isae-supaero <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.instagram.com_isae-5fsupaero_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nee1isfenz9hdsfssliy4w2ryz_fifaeatfjumlrq8e&s=jkpfa89jv8d8pwgb0xfbqdrwbwe_hquq9laupmst8ve&e=> isaecom <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_user_isaecom&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nee1isfenz9hdsfssliy4w2ryz_fifaeatfjumlrq8e&s=4siptpod5uacknmkloxttzrndri3lze2utjvjzp3pyy&e=> isae-supaero <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.linkedin.com_school_isae_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nee1isfenz9hdsfssliy4w2ryz_fifaeatfjumlrq8e&s=ftdafh3kwuva3uoccd1bgvfmmwpr3xcyrif2rpobet4&e=>

subject: postdoc position on microrobotics,  femto-st institute, france in-reply-to: <cadlgpewmnvchftjp8xvbq5h8abmaklxy_cegcuk73d7fdp-z8q@mail.gmail.com> references: <cadlgpewmnvchftjp8xvbq5h8abmaklxy_cegcuk73d7fdp-z8q@mail.gmail.com>
content: postdoc position on microrobotics at femto-st institute (besancon, france) workplace: besancon, france the femto-st institute aims to develop a new untethered microrobot  dedicated to the development of advanced therapy medical products.  advanced therapy medical products (atmps) recently emerged in order to  provide new therapy solutions for patients in therapeutic impasse or for  new therapies. these atmps rely on the use of ?drug cells? exhibiting  new physiological functions, biological characteristics or  reconstitution properties directly inspired from natural processes  occurring in the human organism. however, developing these drug cells  necessitates extracting a few lymphocytes from a blood sample. the microrobot will be equipped with gripping capabilities, and will be  moved and actuated remotely. the robot should be able to navigate in a  blood sample to grasp a given cell, and bring it to a desired location  for further biological analysis. this microrobot should be less than 1  millimeter long, biocompatible and vision based controlled. more information here:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.femto-2dst.fr_sites_default_files_offres_post-2ddoctoralposition-5ffemto-2dst-5fas2m.pdf&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=2qcobceo2fyplxwj-lzzwb2ywf0lccpm-jkig-wqbwk&s=uylgfuemlcxz_w6bkwsum061pj4wjfa5qn9zrnqrfc4&e= == > qualification and responsibilities: solid background in one or more of the following areas: -??? mecatronics -??? robotics -??? vision based control phd in related field any of the following skills will be considered as an asset: -??? previous experience in microrobotics -??? strong motivation for experimental work -??? autonomy and communication skills -??? teamworking the candidate will be in charge of the design, the fabrication and the  control of the robot, as well as the experimental validation. he/she  will also be responsible of all reporting and communication related to  the work. ==>application: position open until filled. candidates should provide a cover letter, a cv and a list of references  via email to aude.bolopion at femto-st.fr --  aude bolopion as2m department - femto-st institute 24 rue alain savary, f-25000 besan?on, france +33 (0)3 81 40 29 25

subject: postdoc on aerial manipulation with  multiple robots at laas-cnrs (toulouse, france)
content: *context* the robotics and interactions (ris) team of laas-cnrs (toulouse, france) is developing new aerial robot systems with manipulation capabilities. the team is among the pioneers in this area, and has a consolidated experience in the framework of european projects.  in this context, the team developed a novel 6dof aerial manipulator, composed of three flying vehicles interconnected by cables, which is called the ?flycrane?. the concept and a motion planning approach were presented in the rss conference (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__hal.archives-2douvertes.fr_hal-2d00919588_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bcxap_v0k6qurjgyhe6kjp17kp95_krg3hnjuhxpf7s&s=alu7ijuzohbbrlitjrlblahv33eicv2sdjxvpqomb3c&e=). the goal of a newly funded project of the team is to improve the flycrane and perform experimental validation in realistic outdoor scenarios. this project will possibly lead to technology transfer in the very dynamic aerospace research and industry cluster in the toulouse area. *job description*  the selected candidate will be at the core of the development, integration and experimental evaluation of the new version of the flycrane. more precisely, she/he will be in charge of: - implementation and experimental evaluation of outdoor gps- and/or vision-based state estimation methods tailored specifically for the flycrane. - implementation and experimental evaluation of the flycrane manipulation control. - design, implementation and experimental evaluation of the flycrane teleoperation system. - design of the scenario for the experimental validation.  *benefits* the positions are fully funded according to the french national laws. postdoc (or research engineer) positions in france are regular jobs with social benefits (e.g., a pension and unemployment plan). you will get access to excellent research facilities (indoor and outdoor flying arenas, electronic and machine workshops, 3d printing, etc.). toulouse is considered center of the european aerospace industry (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_toulouse&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bcxap_v0k6qurjgyhe6kjp17kp95_krg3hnjuhxpf7s&s=et-jt5ns711zpiay24sxbls-yc-suctyilxlpbzfubk&e=) and is ranked among the first three cities in france for living, studying, and working (read, e.g., this article https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.thelocal.fr_20170103_why-2dtoulouse-2dis-2dthe-2dbest-2dplace-2dto-2dbe-2din-2dfrance-2dright-2dnow&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bcxap_v0k6qurjgyhe6kjp17kp95_krg3hnjuhxpf7s&s=mjol4iylslglixg2jkdsnsw0m9vf11wlbywpsxrsm3k&e=).  *who we are* we are in the robotics department of laas-cnrs, one of the largest laboratories of cnrs, the flagship (and largest) center of scientific research in france. laas-cnrs was founded in 1968 and it counts around 700 people, with more than 100 tenured researchers. research at laas-cnrs spans robotics, optimization, control, telecommunications, and nano-systems. the robotics department at laas-cnrs counts more than 100 people and ? being founded at the end of the 70?s ? it is supposedly the largest and oldest robotic research department in france. laas-cnrs has made world-class contributions in artificial intelligence, planning, perception, humanoids, and aerial robot design and control.   *expected skills* - expert in control and state estimation for robotic systems - experience in aerial robotics (i.e. drones) - experience in localization methods for outdoor robots (gps, vision, etc.) - good programming skills in c/c ++ and matlab - familiarity with tools such as ros and opencv - excellent written and spoken english *how to apply* application only through this website (english button on the top-right): - https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__emploi.cnrs.fr_offres_cdd_upr8001-2djuacor-2d003_default.aspx&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bcxap_v0k6qurjgyhe6kjp17kp95_krg3hnjuhxpf7s&s=msggo1pyta_txjwvfgbxlrbor--tzsp1tm3szev_jh0&e= for information other than the application, please contact: - juan cort?s (juan.cortes at laas.fr) and - antonio franchi (antonio.franchi at laas.fr).   *starting date and duration* expected starting date between 1st of february and 1st of april 2019, for a duration of 12 months, with a possible extension to 18 months.

subject: robotics or image processing engineer
content: robotics or image processing engineer start date     february/march 2019 experience   junior/senior description   research engineer medical image processing or robotics. position is fixed-term for a total duration of 12 months location       montpellier, france description ----------------- we are a start-up based in montpellier (southern france) developing a state of the art surgical robot. we are looking for an engineer with  image processing and/or robotics skills to join us in the development of this novel medical device. as an engineer you will work together with the current robotics team to develop a method of coupling the movement of the robot with images coming from a medical imaging device. your work will allow the surgeon to substantially enhance his or her ability to perform difficult surgical procedures and lead to improved patient outcomes that can have a major impact on patients? well-being. what you?ll be doing ----------------------------- => working with the rest of our team and in particular the robotics engineer to interface with and integrate the medical imaging device with the surgical robot => developing c++ image processing and registrations algorithms in 2d and 3d => designing and implementing the c++ modules for interfacing with and controlling the imaging device and the surgical robot via ethernet and/or usb => participating in the selection of the components and working with the component manufacturers => functional and performance tests of the prototype as well as usability tests in a clinical setting who you are ------------------- as the ideal candidate you embrace challenges and like working in a dynamic and stimulating start-up environment. you are looking for a  job where you can have a real impact on the final product and the potential to improve the lives of thousands of patients around the world. you?re a team player and want to be part of a tight-knit team working together towards a common goal. you are also a quick learner and open to new challenges. on the technical side, you are at ease programming in c++ and have experience implementing image processing algorithms and/or c++ based control of mecatronic/robotic components. qualifications and experience ------------------------------------------- => a diploma, masters or doctors degree in computer engineering or similar with specialization in robotics or image processing => experience in object oriented c++ programming,, design patterns and programming under linux => familiarity with common programming tools, revision control (git), code reviews, bug tracking, continuous integration and unit tests => experience with the agile methodology => fluent in english, both written and spoken. good communication skills => excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, curiosity and ability to take initiative => excellent analytical skills, the ability to distill the essential and to quickly resolve problems about us ------------- we are a motivated team of experts, in the initial stages of creating a start-up. we are based in montpellier, a city in southern france known for its dynamic start-up culture. we are driven by the knowledge that our surgical device will revolutionize surgery. it will allow surgeons to perform procedures that are currently very difficult and improve the outcomes and lives of patients around the world. to achieve our vision, we are building a team of creative, motivated and talented individuals who enjoy working in a start-up environment. the position will be based at our office currently located at the robotics laboratory (lirmm) at the university of montpellier. the working environment is in english or french. contact ------------ if you are interested, please send your cv and motivation letter to christoph spuhler (christoph.spuhler at lirmm.fr). cut-off date is january 15, 2019

subject: internship at laas-cnrs in humanoid /  legged robotics
content: title? : automatic motion synthesis for legged robots in cluttered environments: learning / discovering the synergies between sampling based planners and optimization methods. laboratory: laas crns (gepetto), toulouse, france keywords: motion generation, humanoid robotics, computer animation,  optimization contact:  ??? s. tonneau ( stonneau__at__laas.fr ),  ??? p. fernbach ( pfernbach__at__laas.fr ) ====================================== description: the gepetto team is concerned with automatic motion synthesis for legged avatars (robots, virtual characters), in cluttered environments (comprising many obstacles). this problem is open because the resolution of physics constraints requires to formulate optimization problems, which are not able to handle acccurately the collision constraints. in the last few years, we have proposed a framework [1] able to empirically address this issue by decomposing the original problem into 2 subproblems: the collision avoidance problem (a motion planning problem), and a trajectory optimization problem for the robot. this framework is the only one publicly available, has demonstrated its interest in many applications and publications in top journals, and is used by a growing community of research labs. however, the planner is not perfect: the decomposition relies on an approximation of the original problem, which can lead to failures in the motion generation process, even when a solution exists. the objective of this internship is to dramatically improve the success rate of the planner, by focusing on the motion planning problem. using machine learning, statistical analysis, or any relevant method that the intern will propose, he will identify what characterizes the successes and failures cases of the planner, when used to warm-start a trajectory optimization method such as [2]. because the motion planner uses a sampling based approach, this characterization will then be used to propose a biased sampling method which will increase the efficiency of the overall framework.? fulfilling this objective will allow interactive demonstrations on real robots, and lead to a strong publication. a phd thesis could be started on the topic, either in toulouse or at the university of edinburgh. ====================================== environment:  ??? located? in? the? university? town? of? toulouse,? in? the south-west? of? france,? the? gepetto? group belongs to the cnrs-laas, laboratory for the analysis and architecture of systems, a 640 man-strong research center with about 90 people working in robotics. among our robot fleet, we have access to hrp-2 and talos humanoid robots. in the context of this internship, through a collaboration the student may also work with hyq and anymal. the? laboratory? benefits? from? strong? connections? to? the adjoining  ?universities and the space and aeronautics industry. ====================================== diploma required:? on-going master's degree of science or technology ====================================== profile: +? the first requirement is to be open-minded and curious. although this  ?? internship seems tailored to be a machine learning problem, research  ?? is about creativity, and thorough exploration of the state of the art. + good programming skills c++ / python, as the intern will require to use several existing open source projects. + a strong mathematical or control background is desirable. + any? knowledge? or? practical? interest? in? robotics? or computer animation is relevant. ====================================== files to join with the application:  ??? - resume in french or english;  ??? - cover letter;  ???? - any other relevant document: recommendation letters, examples of code, referees... ====================================== references: [1] an efficient acyclic contact planner for multiped robots, tro 2018 steve tonneau, andrea del prete, julien pettr?, chonhyon park, dinesh manocha and nicolas mansard https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__stevetonneau.fr_files_publications_isrr15_isrr15.html&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0ib3rybybey6fnm9zbsvk9vwikxewqqvbuclkampz0c&s=fuou-dyasvcvsjflzlfl1ks-eckithjjpvn2ecgybnu&e= [2] gait and trajectory optimization for legged systems through phase-based end-effector parameterization. winkler, a. w; bellicoso, d. c; hutter, m.; and buchli, j. ieee robotics and automation letters (ra-l), 3: 1560-1567. july 2018. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__cpc.cx_nc6&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0ib3rybybey6fnm9zbsvk9vwikxewqqvbuclkampz0c&s=l6idiokz-xudjfsrnzqyes4sn_apl2xy1-fcevvvoya&e=

subject: phd position in ai & robotics @ inria,  france
content: we have an open phd position financed by the european project heap, starting on march 1st, 2019. the project is focused on grasping irregular objects in a heap. not only the object shape is irregular, but objects could be deformable, articulated, and may break during grasping or transport. picking the objects in the heap is difficult, as it is identifying the single objects as there are occlusions and overlaps. in such cases, classical grasping algorithms are inadequate. the phd position involves using machine learning and human demonstrations to teach a robot manipulator to grasp such irregular objects in a heap. we plan on leveraging human demonstrations, tele-operation, human corrections provided by physical interaction. the idea is to use reinforcement learning to improve the robot ability to grasp, in both single or bimanual configuration of the robot. in some cases, it is possible also to leverage the knowledge of the 3d model of the object, as we will have a dataset of 3d printed object whose model is known. we will use two robots franka, an okulus vr system, kinects cameras. candidates should contact serena ivaldi (pi) via email, sending their cv and list of exams, and any prior publications or activities relevant to the project.  ideal candidates should have a master in robotics, machine learning, computer science or related field, and have a profound interest in machine learning and robotics. the candidate will join the larsen team of inria, an international team with several researchers experts in robotics, machine learning and ai. the lab team is located in nancy, a student-friendly city in the north-east of france (1h30 from paris by train).  the phd position should start immediately (march 1st). --------- serena ivaldi team larsen inria nancy grand-est room c104 tel: (+33) 03-5495-8475 mail: serena.ivaldi at inria.fr web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__members.loria.fr_sivaldi_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wry_pnorx94pvaxaxwgim_7flw3mtkfsfxn-vu7irzk&s=mtg5bv25vc8lbzc8wx-tvyw5clpjah40-aozrdyak7k&e=

subject: two postdoc positions in robotics for  planetary assembly and construction with multiple cooperative mobile robots  at laas-cnrs (toulouse, france)
content: two postdoc positions in robotics for planetary assembly and construction with multiple cooperative mobile robots at laas-cnrs (toulouse, france) **context** the robotics and interactions (ris) team of laas-cnrs (toulouse, france) is developing novel control and planning methods for enabling planetary assembly and construction tasks with multiple cooperative mobile robots. the team is among the pioneers in this area, and has a consolidated experience in the framework of national and european projects. the two positions proposed here are in the context of the h2020 pro-act project, whose goal is to use mobile robotic platforms to build a precursor lunar base for future human settlement. the primary objective of pro-act is to implement and demonstrate multi-robot object manipulation capabilities, in the context of a lunar base construction scenario. **job description** the two selected candidates will be at the core of the development of the cooperative robotic manipulation algorithms. the two postdocs will work, respectively on: ? motion planning aspects, and in particular on the design and implementation of sampling-based motion planning algorithms for coordinated multi-arm manipulation tasks involving closed-chain mechanisms created between the grasped  object and the mobile manipulators arms transporting the object in a cluttered environment.  ? design and implementation of real-time robotic cooperative manipulation control algorithms. such algorithms must ensure safety and accuracy of execution, despite the uncertainties on the dynamic models of the robots and the environment. both postdocs will have a prominent role in the pro-act project, in particular in the interaction with the partners, the preparation of deliverables, etc. **benefits** the positions are fully funded according to the french national laws. postdoc positions in france are regular jobs with social benefits (e.g., a pension, health insurance and unemployment plan). you will get access to excellent research facilities (several state-of-the art robots, electronic and machine workshops, 3d printing, etc.). toulouse is considered center of the european aerospace industry (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_toulouse&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nhv4b7lwu3w6dtvtja90rpsemgj9wu5ijbnyyktj3sq&s=z_zrixfdeaf51xrfwlvjpnw4kwtwkl1sqhtj1xh4dha&e=) and is ranked among the first three cities in france for living, studying, and working (see, e.g., this article https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.thelocal.fr_20170103_why-2dtoulouse-2dis-2dthe-2dbest-2dplace-2dto-2dbe-2din-2dfrance-2dright-2dnow&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nhv4b7lwu3w6dtvtja90rpsemgj9wu5ijbnyyktj3sq&s=elrfkdftgsmt-nw-0qacnw06ukivkkla-h7ablhx7fq&e=).  **who we are** we are in the robotics department of laas-cnrs, one of the largest laboratories of cnrs, the flagship (and largest) center of scientific research in france. laas-cnrs was founded in 1968 and it counts around 700 people, with more than 100 tenured researchers and as many university professors. research at laas-cnrs spans robotics, optimization, control, telecommunications, and nano-systems. the robotics department at laas-cnrs counts more than 100 people and ? being founded at the end of the 70?s ? it is supposedly one of the largest and oldest robotic research department in france. laas-cnrs robotics department has made world-class contributions in artificial intelligence, planning, perception, humanoids, and aerial robot design and control. **expected skills** common to both postdoc positions: ? experience in the basics of robotic manipulators ? good programming skills in c/c ++ and matlab ? familiarity with tools such as ros ? excellent written and spoken english  specific for the position on motion planning: ? expertise in robot motion planning and sampling-based  algorithms specific for the position on control: ? expert in dynamic modeling and motion control of manipulators ? expert in force control and robotic state estimation **starting date and duration**  expected starting date between 1st of march and 1st of may 2019, for a duration of 18 monts, with a possible extension up to 23 months. **how to apply** application only through these websites: ? position on control:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__emploi.cnrs.fr_offres_cdd_upr8001-2dsimlac-2d002_default.aspx-3flang-3den&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nhv4b7lwu3w6dtvtja90rpsemgj9wu5ijbnyyktj3sq&s=nzi-qexugcyc-c8tyc_h00dzpiadgsfrhkypw13uscc&e= subject: m2 internship in robotics simulation  and computer vision (ecole centrale de lyon, france)
content: ?learn-real? is a chist-era european project that aims to improve the reproducibility in learning physical manipulation skills of robots with simulators using realistic variations of the environment (e.g. day/night, good/bad weather).  within this project, one of the task is to provide a toolset to generate synthetic rgb-d images of both textured and texture-less objects (e.g. fruits) with a ground truth for scene understanding ( i.e. , objects, instances, and their 6d pose).  we are seeking a highly motivated intern student (from master or engineering schools) in the field of computer sciences, more specifically applied to machine learning, robotics and simulator/gaming engine. phd funding is secured to potentially extend the internship to a doctoral thesis.  === skills  the candidate should have programming skills (python, c/c++), ideally already applied to machine learning, robotics and/or simulator/gaming engine. fluency in either french or english is required.  more specifically, knowledge on general simulation tools/graphics software (e.g. unity 3d, blender, pybullet) is definitively an advantage, as well as acquaintance with robotics framework and simulators (e.g. gazebo, v-rep, ros) and deep learning methods (e.g. gan). training and support in such techniques and tools will be provided in any case.  ==== environment  the successful candidate will work in direct collaboration with researchers having an established expertise in computer vision and machine learning in partnership with an international academic consortium (idiap/epfl from switzerland and italian institute of technology from italy). ecole centrale de lyon is part of the top ten engineering schools in france (grande ecoles), part of the elite of "grande ecoles" offering access to excellent quality graduate and undergraduate students. a gratification will be provided for the duration of the internship (~500 euros/month)  ==== application  applications should include a curriculum vitae, brief statements of interests and a reference letter.  applications and letters should be sent via electronic mail to:  * dr. maxime petit ( maxime.petit at ec-lyon.fr )

subject: phd opening in reactive trajectory  planning methods for formation control and localization of multi-robot  system
content: the rainbow team at inria/irisa rennes, france https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__team.inria.fr_rainbow_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0dkaxcjurpcygv88dbkpbrgax5yy7vf_jzaw-7vztwa&s=ky3lg7pyfnjialfzc4kgrr2khj9y8isslmgvy78z-_e&e= is looking for a phd candidate in *reactive trajectory planning methods  for formation control and localization of multi-robot system* *********** context *********** the main basic problems when addressing decentralized (and sensor-based)  formation control for multiple robots are two: formation control and  relative localization. formation control is the problem of devising  control strategies for attaining some desired geometric arrangement in  space (e.g., a target shape). relative localization is the problem of  estimating/recovering the robot relative poses from the available  onboard sensor measurements (typically, distances or bearing angles).  once one is able to solve these two problems, much more complex  tasks/missions become possible (e.g., exploration, patrolling, coverage,  but also cooperative manipulation). the localization and formation control problems are intimately related:  any formation controller needs availability of the robot relative poses  which must be estimated/recovered from the sensor measurements. however,  the localization itself is a nonlinear estimation problem and,  therefore, the motion/trajectory followed by the robots (i.e., the  action imposed by the formation controller) has a strong impact in the  performance/accuracy/convergence rate of the relative pose estimation.  this tight loop between formation control and estimation (which is the  multi-robot version of the classical ?action/perception loop? in  robotics) is both scientifically very interesting and practically very  relevant (one needs to properly solve it for having the hope of  deploying multi-robot teams in real-world conditions). the vast majority of formation control and localization algorithms are  essentially local: they aim at obtaining the best control  actions/estimations ?right now? given the current state of the robot  group, but they cannot reason about the future. however, since several  years many modern control approaches for non-trivial robotics  applications stress the importance of a proper trajectory planning for  accomplishing a task in more robust and effective ways. indeed,  (reactive) trajectory planning allows to reason about the future  consequences of local actions, to better take into account complex  constraints (e.g., obstacle avoidance, limited actuation, sensing  constraints), and, finally, to attain optimality w.r.t. criteria of  interest (e.g., time, energy, control effort). while reactive trajectory planning approaches (or model predictive  control ? mpc) have gained a lot of ground in the robotics field (one  example for all, humanoid robotics), their use in the context of  multi-robot formation control and localization is still quite limited.  on the other hand, the complexity of controlling a multi-robot group in  harsh environments (sensing constraints, limited  actuation/communication/processing power, obstacle and self-collision  avoidance, need to estimate some group properties at runtime) would  clearly call for the use of modern reactive trajectory planning  approaches in order to better deal with the problems of formation  control and localization in unstructured environments. this is not a  trivial issue, since one has to address all the typical  issues/sensing/communication constraints of multi-robots, as well as  comply with the requirements of decentralization and scalability (i.e.,  ideally, each robot should be able to plan its own future trajectory by  only exploiting sensed/communicated information from the closest neighbors). *********** phd topic *********** in this context, the goal of this phd thesis is to close this gap and  develop novel reactive trajectory planning algorithms tailored to the  multi-robot case. these algorithms should allow for an effective  resolution of the ?multi-robot perception/action loop?, i.e., formation  control and localization, in realistic settings: limited sensing (e.g.,  fov, range), limited actuation, limited communication, presence of  obstacles. global objectives (e.g., exploration/patrolling) or  optimality criteria (e.g., energy consumption, localization accuracy)  should also be taken into account. the phd activities will naturally leverage the strong internal  competences on multi-robot control/optimal estimation and on trajectory  planning, and will be performed in cooperation with the chorale team at  inria sophia antipolis (in particular p. salaris as co-supervisor). the  devised algorithms will be first tested in a simulation environment and  then implemented and validated on the several quadrotor uavs available  in the team (in an indoor motion capture arena). *********** candidate's expected profile *********** the candidate must be a proficient user of c/c++ and ros. familiarity  with matlab/simulink and/or relevant computer vision library (e.g.,  visp, opencv, pcl) are a plus. scientific curiosity, large autonomy and  ability to work independently are also expected. a m.sc. degree in computer science, robotics, engineering, applied  mathematics (or related fields) is required. *********** salary *********** the position is full-time for 3 years and will be paid according to the  french salary regulations for phd students. ***********  environment *********** the rainbow team https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__team.inria.fr_rainbow_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0dkaxcjurpcygv88dbkpbrgax5yy7vf_jzaw-7vztwa&s=ky3lg7pyfnjialfzc4kgrr2khj9y8isslmgvy78z-_e&e= is internationally recognized for its scientific activity as well as for  technology transfer experiences in the field of visual tracking, visual  servoing, computer vision and sensor-based control for robotics  applications. the facilities available in the group include three 6-dof  industrial manipulator arms, a 6-dof torque-controlled backdrivable arm,  two 7-dof torque-controlled robot arm (franka), a pioneer indoor mobile  robot, two humanoid robots (romeo and pepper), a fleet of quadrotor  uavs, and an indoor testing arena instrumented with vicon. the candidates will be under the supervision of *dr. paolo robuffo giordano* https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__team.inria.fr_rainbow_team_prg_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0dkaxcjurpcygv88dbkpbrgax5yy7vf_jzaw-7vztwa&s=1eyi62bzrxvgdrc4ljr9tdkqnikh57ypqvy6xrme_uq&e= and *dr. paolo salaris* https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__project.inria.fr_chorale_members_paolo-2dsalaris_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0dkaxcjurpcygv88dbkpbrgax5yy7vf_jzaw-7vztwa&s=7qroxhmtiloukdutxasgkpc_vdvt1zdms5sc37peouc&e= and will work in close collaboration with other members of the rainbow  group involved in the project. the rainbow group is part of the inria/irisa lab that spreads its  activities in 30 research teams working in computer science, signal  processing, and control. it involves about 650 people, including 120  professors and assistant professors, 100 full-time researchers, 80  administrative staff, and 250 phd students. ***********  how to apply  *********** instructions on how to apply can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__team.inria.fr_rainbow_phd-2dmulti-2drobot-2dplanning_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0dkaxcjurpcygv88dbkpbrgax5yy7vf_jzaw-7vztwa&s=gikv9-wmrsjdhg3eqd4i2e348jlbpuoqpi-weybp3rg&e= the position will remain open until a satisfactory candidate is found --  dr. paolo robuffo giordano centre national de la recherche scientifique (cnrs) rainbow team, irisa and inria bretagne atlantique campus universitaire de beaulieu 35042 rennes cedex, france tel: +33 (0)2 99842545 fax: +33 (0)2 99847171 email: prg at irisa.fr website: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__team.inria.fr_rainbow_team_prg_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0dkaxcjurpcygv88dbkpbrgax5yy7vf_jzaw-7vztwa&s=1eyi62bzrxvgdrc4ljr9tdkqnikh57ypqvy6xrme_uq&e= youtube: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_channel_ucihvw3xxlbgxr4-2d9zalju8w&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0dkaxcjurpcygv88dbkpbrgax5yy7vf_jzaw-7vztwa&s=q-3sqb3sge-ujnzckocln6tfsgeqyvsou_nqp3fzx7c&e=

subject: postdoctoral research position in image  processing and fusion at lirmm - france in-reply-to: <3bf25232-822e-3f29-1f16-d6f84ab71ca5@lirmm.fr> references: <3bf25232-822e-3f29-1f16-d6f84ab71ca5@lirmm.fr>
content: dear all, we have a postdoctoral research position in the field of image  processing and fusion at lirmm lab. - university of montpellier - france. this position is within a new translational research project at lirmm  lab. in collaboration with the ent department of the montpellier hospital that concerns ??surgical gesture guidance for auditory  neuroprosthestics implantation based on us/ct images fusion??. this project is funded by the ??act for audition foundation??. context: cochlear implant is first functional implantable neuroprosthestic device  in human. it restores the auditory perception in people with severe to  profound deafness. the implantation of such a device requires the insertion into the  cochlea of an electrode array allowing electrical stimulation of  auditory nerve end fibbers. however, this insertion is a critical point of the surgery since the  surgeon cannot control visually the trajectory of the electrode array  and has to rely on its tactile feedback. this is responsible in many cases of damages of the cochlear structures  and of the loss of residual hearing, thus preventing the extension of  cochlear implant to people with milder hearing loss. in this project, we aim at developing a new tool to help cochlear  electrode arrays? insertion using the fusion of intraoperative  ultrasound (us) imaging and preoperative x-ray ct scan. a new custom made us probe dedicated to  cochlear navigation is under development. the candidate will be responsible for : - developing and validating a new algorithm for us/ct image fusion and  registration for cochlear imaging, - implementing the developed algorithm in a navigation software allowing  real-time rendering of fused us-ct imaging to be able to use it in a  clinical set-up, - validating it in ex-vivo experimental platforms and on cadavers. we are looking for candidates with strong analytical background and  hands-on experience in systems integration and medical image processing. she/he should have a phd degree in medical image processing or related  disciplines. previous experience in computer-assisted surgery is highly  appreciated. english: cefr b2 level (minimum) salary: montpellier university grid ? according to cv contract duration: 12 months (renewable) expected starting date: march 2019 laboratory / team: lirmm lab., robotics department, dexter team, medical  robotics group application: thanks for sending your cv, a cover letter, and contact information of  two referees to: philippe.poignet at lirmm.fr and? nabil.zemiti at lirmm.fr regards nabil zemiti, phd

subject: two postdoc  positions at laas-cnrs (toulouse,  france) on mobile manipulation for planetary assembly and construction
content: two postdoc positions in robotics for planetary assembly and construction with multiple cooperative mobile robots at laas-cnrs (toulouse, france) **context** the robotics and interactions (ris) team of laas-cnrs (toulouse, france) is developing novel control and planning methods for enabling planetary assembly and construction tasks with multiple cooperative mobile robots. the team is among the pioneers in this area, and has a consolidated experience in the framework of national and european projects. the two positions proposed here are in the context of the h2020 pro-act project, whose goal is to use mobile robotic platforms to build a precursor lunar base for future human settlement. the primary objective of pro-act is to implement and demonstrate multi-robot object manipulation capabilities, in the context of a lunar base construction scenario. **job description** the two selected candidates will be at the core of the development of the cooperative robotic manipulation algorithms. the two postdocs will work, respectively on: ? motion planning aspects, and in particular on the design and implementation of sampling-based motion planning algorithms for coordinated multi-arm manipulation tasks involving closed-chain mechanisms created between the grasped  object and the mobile manipulators arms transporting the object in a cluttered environment.  ? design and implementation of real-time robotic cooperative manipulation control algorithms. such algorithms must ensure safety and accuracy of execution, despite the uncertainties on the dynamic models of the robots and the environment. both postdocs will have a prominent role in the pro-act project, in particular in the interaction with the partners, the preparation of deliverables, etc. **benefits** the positions are fully funded according to the french national laws. postdoc positions in france are regular jobs with social benefits (e.g., a pension, health insurance and unemployment plan). you will get access to excellent research facilities (several state-of-the art robots, electronic and machine workshops, 3d printing, etc.). toulouse is considered center of the european aerospace industry (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_toulouse&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=8ck1cgkywxjuaysi7vef8ukykb_hldieuz-6mh6gy2g&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_toulouse&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=8ck1cgkywxjuaysi7vef8ukykb_hldieuz-6mh6gy2g&e=>) and is ranked among the first three cities in france for living, studying, and working (see, e.g., this article https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.thelocal.fr_20170103_why-2dtoulouse-2dis-2dthe-2dbest-2dplace-2dto-2dbe-2din-2dfrance-2dright-2dnow&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=_herljespd4i9xaz-z0ytjqbha6nsycuhen-_tewsys&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.thelocal.fr_20170103_why-2dtoulouse-2dis-2dthe-2dbest-2dplace-2dto-2dbe-2din-2dfrance-2dright-2dnow&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=_herljespd4i9xaz-z0ytjqbha6nsycuhen-_tewsys&e=>).  **who we are** we are in the robotics department of laas-cnrs, one of the largest laboratories of cnrs, the flagship (and largest) center of scientific research in france. laas-cnrs was founded in 1968 and it counts around 700 people, with more than 100 tenured researchers and as many university professors. research at laas-cnrs spans robotics, optimization, control, telecommunications, and nano-systems. the robotics department at laas-cnrs counts more than 100 people and ? being founded at the end of the 70?s ? it is supposedly one of the largest and oldest robotic research department in france. laas-cnrs robotics department has made world-class contributions in artificial intelligence, planning, perception, humanoids, and aerial robot design and control. **expected skills** common to both postdoc positions: ? experience in the basics of robotic manipulators ? good programming skills in c/c ++ and matlab ? familiarity with tools such as ros ? excellent written and spoken english  specific for the position on motion planning: ? expertise in robot motion planning and sampling-based  algorithms specific for the position on control: ? expert in dynamic modeling and motion control of manipulators ? expert in force control and robotic state estimation **starting date and duration**  expected starting date between 1st of march and 1st of may 2019, for a duration of 18 monts, with a possible extension up to 23 months. **how to apply** application (cv, statements, references, papers, ?) only through these websites: ? position on control:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__emploi.cnrs.fr_offres_cdd_upr8001-2dsimlac-2d002_default.aspx-3flang-3den&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=0siav3qtaulrtezbsi0po2hxouypqmpxl-tcf_tcj_q&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__emploi.cnrs.fr_offres_cdd_upr8001-2dsimlac-2d002_default.aspx-3flang-3den&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=0siav3qtaulrtezbsi0po2hxouypqmpxl-tcf_tcj_q&e=> ? position on planning: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__emploi.cnrs.fr_offres_cdd_upr8001-2dsimlac-2d003_default.aspx-3flang-3den&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=th8-bxxa8btgvtgz8fs0svjeezybx9xn9jvdgsx1xam&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__emploi.cnrs.fr_offres_cdd_upr8001-2dsimlac-2d003_default.aspx-3flang-3den&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=th8-bxxa8btgvtgz8fs0svjeezybx9xn9jvdgsx1xam&e=>   ** for information other than the application**  contact: simon.lacroix at laas.fr <mailto:simon.lacroix at laas.fr>, antonio.franchi at laas.fr <mailto:antonio.franchi at laas.fr>, nic at laas.fr <mailto:nic at laas.fr> -------------------------------------------------------------- thierry simeon  cnrs researcher laas-cnrs, robotics and interactions group https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__homepages.laas.fr_nic_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wtdxqb8iqr2p-jtjv1roml5my0apdiejq4imhqpgboy&s=xmz11yfv9lvcj1poywqehmz8gkgczuxct5py6qz97x8&e= subject: marie curie - phd position in medical  robotics: distributed proprioception for safe autonomous catheters (kul  sssa)
content: we are looking for highly motivated candidates to fill in a phd position on: *distributed proprioception for safe autonomous catheters (esr3)* the interaction between flexible instrument bodies and surrounding  deformable lumens is intrinsically complex and hard to oversee if not  explicitly measured. esr3 identifies and integrates optimal sensing  technology for real-time proprioception along the deformable body. this project includes real time shape estimation based on optical  measurements such as fbgs or relying on electromagnetic (em) tracking.  it explores new sensing methods such as electrical impedance tomography  (eit) or algorithms that estimate the contact location and amplitude of  the interaction force based on the acquired shape estimates. automatic  calibration and registration techniques will be developed, so that  resulting techniques may be employed ?out of the box? requiring minimal  effort and tuning prior to deployment. (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_we-2dare-2dhiring_vacancies_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=jnkfhv9gau2ogsies_b6mm4kvknsakfg303vtd_xtla&e=) the ph.d. is part of the marie curie innovative training network atlas. the ph.d. will be hosted by - ku leuven, belgium (primary institution) - scuola superiore sant'anna, pisa italy. atlas (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=exnpyw2nkljqhixgbsd56-yhar8sn08mhfa6nodgul4&e=) is a marie curie itn-ejd project  (innovative training network ? european joint doctorate, ga no 813782)  that targets the training of experts in a very specific branch of  robotic surgery. within this scheme, 15 ph.d. positions are funded. the consortium is formed by - ku leuven - belgium - tu delft  - the netherlands - universit? de strasbourg - france - politecnico di milano - italy - universit? di verona - italy - scuola superiore sant?anna ? italy (pisa) - universitat polit?cnica de catalunya ?  spain  (barcellona) upon successful completion, each ph.d. candidate will be awarded a  double ph.d. degree. more information on how to apply can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atlas-2ditn.eu_we-2dare-2dhiring_recruitment-2dprocedure_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=try_zy_t9bkloirga8svuww8r689-mqhrtfnytksbwq&s=omyp6v44qu1zkk9-8eoqbbhw4wtqj_idehjb5ihypoa&e= envisioned closing date for application submission is 7th of march. --  ------------------------------------------------ gianni borghesan, phd robot assisted surgery group robotics research group ku leuven, department of mechanical engineering, division of pma room 04.214 celestijnenlaan 300b, b-3001 heverlee, belgium. tel: +32 163 29267 ------------------------------------------------

subject: research assistant in robotics at ucl -  university college london
content: applications are invited for a research assistant in robotics to join the ucl aspire create team for 6 months (full-time / part-time / job-share), on the crowdbot project. crowdbot (aka ?safe robot navigation in dense crowds?) is a eur 4m horizon 2020 consortium of 5 universities and 2 industrial partners: inria, france (co-ordinator); epfl, switzerland; ethz, switzerland; rwth, germany; ucl, uk; sbr europe, france; and loc gmbh, germany. crowdbot brings together world-leading robotics experts to develop the next-generation of robots capable of navigating crowded environments. ucl is leading a core workpackage on the co-design and evaluation of the crowdbot system, as well as developing one of the demonstrators: a crowd-aware smart wheelchair.   the aspire centre for rehabilitation engineering and assistive technology (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ucl.ac.uk_aspire-2dcreate&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=17-uhawbj5ln19mns_9lkdatoopakwlq5wo0mpb40za&s=puihkp31ogzuf1uvdcecx5jotfrhmuiykrqwalxpnvy&e=) is physically located on the ucl stanmore campus and is integrated into both the royal national orthopaedic hospital and the aspire charity, which gives us unprecedented access to clinicians, patients and assistive technology providers. the postholder will be working as part of a team to develop our smart wheelchair platform. you will primarily be making mechatronic modifications to a commercially available wheelchair, instrumenting it with a suite of sensors and working on the power and data distribution systems. you will be responsible for the low-level testing and documentation of these modifications, which will be used by the rest of the team. for full details, please see job ref 1792341 on jobs at ucl, or click here:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__atsv7.wcn.co.uk_search-5fengine_jobs.cgi-3fsid-3damnvzgu9mtc5mjm0msz2df90zw1wbgf0zt05njumb3duzxi9nta0mte3oczvd25lcnr5cgu9zmfpcizicmfuzf9pzd0wjmpvyl9yzwzfy29kzt0xnzkymzqxjnbvc3rpbmdfy29kzt0ymjq-3d&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=17-uhawbj5ln19mns_9lkdatoopakwlq5wo0mpb40za&s=cxgkpbzabdg6a27ej2ncvqnbkf2pj2bys6rvkpivpfq&e=
